p: Figure 3a displays case incidence by season and hemisphere. Across all countries, 76% of all cases occurred in winter and spring. In the winter and spring periods combined (n = 462), 3.1 times as many cases occurred as in the summer and fall months combined (n = 149). Among non-equatorial countries, 81% of cases occurred in winter and spring periods combined (n = 355), representing a 4.3-fold increase over summer and fall months combined (n = 83).
